sentences.english: I was embarrassed for her when she slipped and fell.
sentences.chinese: 當她滑了一跤跌倒時，我替她感到困窘。

sentences.english: We are likely to be disconcerted by hiatuses of thought.
sentences.chinese: 我們很可能因思緒的中斷而感到困窘。

sentences.english: Why should the lot of rural workers be so miserable?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼有那麼多農村勞工的生活如此困窘呢？

sentences.english: My face went hot with embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 我的臉因爲困窘而發熱了。

sentences.english: Eg. : They look at each other embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 他們困窘地互相注視對方。

sentences.english: He scratched his head in perplexity.
THE debt crisis has presented investors with an extremely awkward dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 債務危機使投資者陷入困窘的兩難境地。

sentences.english: She felt very awkward about the unpleasant situation.
sentences.chinese: 她因不愉快的場面而感到十分困窘。

sentences.english: It embarrasses me even to think about my foolish behavior.
sentences.chinese: 哪怕是想一想我愚蠢的行爲，我都感到困窘不安。

sentences.english: Hardship and opposition are the native soil of manhood and self-reliance.
sentences.chinese: 困窘和敵對是剛毅和自立更生的天然土壤。

sentences.english: She felt abashed at the man's daring.
sentences.chinese: 她對這人的大膽感到困窘。

definition: hard pressed for money/in financial straits
anxious and perplexed/uneasy and confused/suspicious and fearful
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
